strategy: Adopt a time-varying mixed strategy where the row player randomizes between coordinating on the preferred outcome (e.g., watching a movie or going to a stadium) based on the opponent's historical behavior. Specifically, if the column player has chosen the movie option in the last 3 rounds, increase the probability of choosing the movie to 0.6; otherwise, choose the stadium with probability 0.7. This leverages behavioral anticipation without assuming perfect information.
